title: 107_s1210
content:
The curr_chunk is a section header titled "SHORT TITLE." The Act is named the "Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002." It reauthorizes the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 by extending block grants, federal guarantees, training, and technical assistance until 2007. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is extended until 2007, with amendments to training, technical assistance, and Indian Housing Loan Guarantee Fund for fiscal years 1997 through 2007. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS.

The term 'housing related community development' refers to tribally-owned facilities or infrastructure that aid in the construction of reservation housing and reduce construction costs. It excludes activities under the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act.

SEC. 4. BLOCK GRANTS AND GRANT REQUIREMENTS. SEC. 4. BLOCK GRANTS AND GRANT REQUIREMENTS. Section 101(h) of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include comprehensive housing and community development planning activities. SEC. 5. TREATMENT OF PROGRAM INCOME AND LABOR STANDARDS. Amendments are made to Section 104 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 regarding the utilization of program income for housing-related activities. SEC. 6. REGULATIONS. Section 106(b)(2)(A) of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include regulations required under the Act, including any amendments made after the enactment date. Section 601 is amended to include housing-related community development activities. Feasibility studies are proposed to improve housing assistance delivery in Native communities. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include a feasibility study for a community development demonstration project in Native communities. The study aims to assess the potential for tribes to use funds for designing and implementing housing projects. The Secretary will conduct a study on the feasibility of establishing a demonstration project for Indian tribes to receive assistance in designing and implementing Federal housing projects, maximizing tribal authority and decision-making. Congress requested a study on the feasibility of creating a demonstration project for Indian tribes to receive assistance in Federal housing projects, maximizing tribal authority in decision-making. The Secretary must submit the study to relevant Senate and House committees within one year of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must complete a study on black mold infestation in Native American housing within 180 days of this Act. A report with recommendations to address the infestation must be submitted to Congress.
